as

Section 1 of Annex V to the Council Directive;”,

in Regulation 5 –

“14A. (1) 
of complying with provisions with respect to the exchange of 
information contained in the Council Directive, the requested 
information shall be foreseeably relevant where, at the time the 
request is made, and where shown to the satisfaction of the 
competent authority, the requesting authority considers that, in 
accordance with its national law, there is a reasonable possibility 
that the requested information will be – 

(a) 

(b) 

relevant, to the tax affairs of one or more persons, 
whether identified by name or otherwise, and 

justified for the purposes of enquiries being 
carried out into the tax affairs of that person or 
those persons. 

(2) The 

requesting authority 

the 
foreseeable relevance of the requested information by providing 
the following information to the competent authority: 

shall demonstrate 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

in relation to the person to whom the request 
refers, that person’s name and TIN, or where that 
person’s name or TIN are not known to the 
requesting authority, such other information in 
the possession of the requesting authority which 
may be used to identify the person concerned; 

the tax purpose for which the information is 
requested; 

a specification of the information required for the 
administration or enforcement of the requesting 
authority’s national law. 

(3) Where the request relates to a group or class of person 
whose individual identifies are not known, the requesting

authority shall demonstrate that the requested information is 
foreseeably relevant by providing to the competent authority, in 
addition to the information referred to in paragraph (2), the 
following information: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

a detailed description of the group or class of 
persons; 

an explanation of both the applicable law and of 
the facts based on which the requesting authority 
believes that the persons in the group or class 
have not complied with the applicable tax law; 

an explanation of how the requested information 
would assist in determining compliance by the 
persons in the group or class with the applicable 
tax law; 

(d) where relevant, the facts and circumstances 
relating to the involvement of a third party that 
the potential nonto 
actively contributed 
compliance of the persons in the group with the 
applicable law. 

(4) In addition to the matters specified in paragraphs (2) and 
(3), the requesting authority shall provide such other information 
as the competent authority may require to be satisfied that, in 
accordance with the national law of the requesting jurisdiction, 
there is a reasonable possibility that the requested information 
will be – 

(a) 

(b) 

relevant, to the tax affairs of one or more person, 
whether identified by name or otherwise, and 

justified for the purposes of enquiries being 
carried out into the tax affairs of that person.”.

20 December, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH,
